title: AI IN INVESTMENTS AND TRADING
description: Learn how AI is applied in investments, robo-advisors, and algorithmic trading to make smarter financial decisions.

items.title: Definition
items.content: Investing means putting money into assets like stocks, bonds, or mutual funds with the goal of growing your money over time.

items.title: Risk & Return
items.content: The key principle is that risk and return are connected—higher risks can lead to higher returns but also greater losses.

blocks.content: What are Stocks and Mutual Funds?

items.title: Stocks
items.content: Stocks are individual stakes in a company that anyone can buy. A company’s performance influences the value of its stock.

items.title: Mutual Funds
items.content: Mutual Funds pool money from many investors to invest in a diversified set of stocks, bonds, or other assets, reducing risk through diversification.

blocks.content: In India, platforms like Zerodha or Groww allow people to invest in stocks or mutual funds without needing to understand complex financial concepts.

items.title: Definition
items.content: A robo-advisor is an AI-driven tool that provides personalized investment advice based on an individual’s financial situation, goals, and risk tolerance.

items.title: Portfolio Management
items.content: Robo-advisors can manage entire investment portfolios and are used by regular investors as well as professional traders.

items.title: AI Role
items.content: AI analyzes user data such as age, income, financial goals, and risk tolerance to recommend a suitable investment portfolio.

blocks.content: Users complete a questionnaire outlining their goals (e.g., retirement, buying a home) and risk level (conservative, moderate, aggressive). Based on this, robo-advisors recommend a diversified mix of stocks, ETFs, bonds, and savings products.
Groww and SIP Calculator by Kuvera use AI to create personalized investment portfolios. They recommend low-risk options for conservative investors and high-return options for aggressive investors.
Trading algorithms use AI to make decisions on buying and selling investments. They analyze historical data, real-time market conditions, and predictive models to determine the best times to trade.
Trading bots automatically execute trades based on predefined strategies. They can make decisions in milliseconds, allowing traders to capitalize on small price movements.
Platforms like Upstox and Zerodha offer tools for algorithmic trading, enabling traders to automate and speed up their trading strategies using AI.
